title: 32 detained Bangladeshis, 47 Indian fishermen swapped
body: Thirty-two Bangladeshi fishermen detained in India and 47 Indian fishermen detained in Bangladesh were reciprocally repatriated on Tuesday. The swap was organised in the Bay of Bengal, on the International Maritime Boundary Line where the Bangladesh Coast Guard received 32 Bangladeshi fishermen from the Indian Coast Guard and handed over 47 Indian fishermen to them, said a press release issued by the ministry of foreign affairs. Moreover, the Indian Coast Guard returned one Bangladesh-owned fishing boat, while the Bangladesh Coast Guard returned three India-owned fishing boats in the reciprocal repatriation. Furthermore, six Bangladeshi fishermen, who were detained in Meghalaya in India, will be repatriated today through Nakugaon Land Port of Sherpur district under the supervision of the Border Guard Bangladesh, said the release, adding that the BGB and Indiaâ€™s Border Security Force were working for the repatriation. The repatriation process has been implemented through coordinated efforts of foreign ministry, home ministry, fisheries and livestock ministry, shipping ministry, Bangladesh Coast Guard, BGB, Bangladesh Police, local administration and other relevant agencies.
